reasoning: Major version upgrades (0.2.x → 0.3.x) for LangChain dependencies require research for breaking changes and will likely affect multiple files (requirements.txt, graph.py, agent_graph.py). Single service with no infrastructure changes keeps it at standard complexity rather than complex.

scope.notes: Will modify requirements.txt and likely need compatibility fixes in graph.py, agent_graph.py. May need test updates if API changes affect test assertions.

integrations.notes: Not adding new integrations, but major version upgrades (langchain 0.2→0.3, langgraph 0.1→0.2, langgraph-checkpoint 1.x→2.x) require researching migration guides and breaking changes.

infrastructure.notes: Only requirements.txt changes. No Docker, database, or environment variable modifications needed.

knowledge.notes: Codebase already uses LangChain/LangGraph, so patterns exist. However, research needed for API changes in major version upgrades (0.2.x → 0.3.x migration guides).

concerns: Major version bumps typically introduce breaking changes
RAG workflow must continue functioning (acceptance criteria)
risk.notes: Medium risk due to major version changes and strict acceptance criteria. Backward compatibility issues likely but scope is contained to single service.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Major dependency upgrades require thorough testing. Unit tests (pytest backend/tests/) must pass per acceptance criteria. Integration testing needed to verify RAG workflow functionality. No security-sensitive changes, so security scan not required.
